p: Among pig workers, there were 29 ARI episodes (cumulative incidence of 16.9%) while among non-pig workers there were 122 ARI episodes (cumulative incidence 26.9%). On bivariate analysis, pig workers had a 47% lower risk of having ARI compared to non-pig workers with an unadjusted risk ratio (RR) of 0.53 (95% CI [0.33, 0.84]).
